title: Remove some unecessary files in repo
message: Remove some unecessary files in repo

title: Add frame skip to Game Loop
message:
Add frame skip to Game Loop

On slow devices, it's better to skip some game processing so the game
run slower (and you can see what is happening if your device only
renders few frames per second, instead of seeing the ball jumps like
crazy). The game is pretty light on resources anyway, so no real devices
should trigger this behavior, but this is a small change anyway.

title: Implemented a new way to set the direction of ball after hit the paddle.
message:
Implemented a new way to set the direction of ball after hit the paddle.

We see the paddle as a circumference (actually, as half of a
circumference). If the ball hit the left part of the paddle, it will
move to the left (analogously to the right). The angle of reflection is
proportional to how far from the center the ball hit the paddle.

the level restarts (not implemented yet)

title: Remove speed parameter from Ball object
message:
Remove speed parameter from Ball object

Updating ball rendering and collision detection asynchrony seems to
cause weird bugs (like the ball colliding on nothing when it bounces on
the corner of the screen). This is probably because with async updates
the collision can be detected too late (when the ball already passed the
"safe" X and Y position) so it gets a position where the ball can bounce
forever (or at least until the position gets to a safe place again).

So if we do need to lower requirements to get a acceptable performance,
it's better to just limit the frame rate of rendering (see commit
310d6d0ee55) instead of trying to be clever creating a async update.

title: Add FPS counter
message:
Add FPS counter

I did removed frame limitter but I am afraid that some devices maybe too
slow to run this game smooth. So just add FPS counter and maintain the
frame limitter.

title: Substitute frame rate limitter to FPS status
message:
Substitute frame rate limitter to FPS status

Since Android seems to be limited to 60FPS, doesn't make much sense to
have a frame rate limitter.

title: Move frame rate limitter to TouchSurfaceView
message:
Move frame rate limitter to TouchSurfaceView

This makes more sense since we can control the whole frame rate this way
(including paddle) instead of only limitting the frame rate of Game
rendered objects (ball and bricks).

message:

filter all log spam.
